description: Borrowed from Italian centesimo. Doublet of centime.

entries.meaning: (historical) A unit of currency constituting one hundredth of a lira. [from 19th c.]
A monetary unit worth one-hundredth of the main currency in Uruguay, Panama and (formerly) Chile. [from 19th c.]
examples: And if they were talking 3-5-2, it referred only to the centesimos they were cutting, filing and preparing to throw at the Australian players from the stands throughout the match.
